content:
i just tried to validate a profiled patient resource against its profile(which includes slicing) with the $validate operation. I found no public testserver which was able to do that. In our own HAPI 2.0 server logfile i can see that validation with slicing isn't supported yet.
Is there any server or method which can validate profiled resources with profiles containing slicing? I tried this with this profile: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/uslab/patient-uslab.html
as resource i used the example from the patient-uslab page and added the missing meta.profile content
as of the last week or so
hadn't looked at the STU3 Servers, thanks Grahame i'll try that.

sorry i have to bring this topic up again. As the LabNorway profile for the FhirDevDays is made in DSTU2, and the PatientNorway profile contains slicing. I'm still searching for a solution to validate DSTU2 resources against a sliced profile. I tried the java validort and i get:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: not done yet
After some reading i realised, the java validator cli validator is the same as the one included in HAPI. So slicing isn't supported yet.
Has anyone an idea how to validate then? My students would be happy to be able to do so. @Marten Smits ?

@Patrick Werner An upcoming new release of the FHIR .NET API will provide support for validation, specifically for validating instances against profiles. The new logic is currently under development, but mostly finished. Stay tuned!
I think you can use the R3 validator for this now, but I think I might need to do some packaging for R2 support...
